intro: Pleurogyne oreocharis, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open, sandy soils, often in heathland or coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its showy, golden-yellow inflorescences that resemble misty clouds, hence its common name. Its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly honeyeaters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pleurogyne oreocharis is considered vulnerable and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
